verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph. <WH623> Truly <WH389> God <WH430> is good <WH2896> to Israel, <WH3478> even to such as are of a clean <WH1249> heart. <WH3824>
But as for me, my feet <WH7272> were almost <WH4592> gone; <WH5186> my steps <WH838> had well <WH369> near <WH4592> slipped. <WH8210>
For I was envious <WH7065> at the foolish, <WH1984> when I saw <WH7200> the prosperity <WH7965> of the wicked. <WH7563>
For there are no <WH369> bands <WH2784> in their death: <WH4194> but their strength <WH193> is firm. <WH1277>
They are not in trouble <WH5999> as other men; <WH582> neither <WH3808> are they plagued <WH5060> like <WH5973> other men. <WH120>
Therefore pride <WH1346> compasses <WH6059> them about as a chain; <WH6059> violence <WH2555> covers <WH5848> them as a garment. <WH7897>
Their eyes <WH5869> stand <WH3318> out with fatness: <WH2459> they have more <WH5674> than heart <WH3824> could wish. <WH4906>
They are corrupt, <WH4167> and speak <WH1696> wickedly <WH7451> concerning oppression: <WH6233> they speak <WH1696> loftily. <WH4791>
They set <WH8371> their mouth <WH6310> against the heavens, <WH8064> and their tongue <WH3956> walks <WH1980> through the earth. <WH776>
Therefore <WH3651> his people <WH5971> return <WH7725> here: <WH1988> and waters <WH4325> of a full <WH4392> cup are wrung <WH4680> out to them.
And they say, <WH559> How <WH349> does God <WH410> know? <WH3045> and is there knowledge <WH1844> in the most <WH5945> High? <WH5945>
Behold, <WH2009> these <WH428> are the ungodly, <WH7563> who prosper <WH7951> in the world; <WH5769> they increase <WH7685> in riches. <WH2428>
Truly <WH389> I have cleansed <WH2135> my heart <WH3824> in vain, <WH7385> and washed <WH7364> my hands <WH3709> in innocence. <WH5356>
For all <WH3605> the day <WH3117> long have I been <WH1961> plagued, <WH5060> and chastened <WH8433> every morning. <WH1242>
If <WH518> I say, <WH559> I will speak <WH5608> thus; <WH3644> behold, <WH2009> I should offend <WH898> against the generation <WH1755> of your children. <WH1121>
When I thought <WH2803> to know <WH3045> this, <WH2063> it was too painful <WH5999> for me;
Until <WH5704> I went <WH935> into <WH413> the sanctuary <WH4720> of God; <WH410> then understood <WH995> I their end. <WH319>
Surely <WH389> you did set <WH7896> them in slippery <WH2513> places: you cast <WH5307> them down <WH5307> into destruction. <WH4876>
How <WH349> are they brought into desolation, <WH8047> as in a moment! <WH7281> they are utterly consumed <WH8552> with terrors. <WH1091>
As a dream <WH2472> when one wakes; <WH6974> so, O Lord, <WH136> when you wake, <WH5782> you shall despise <WH959> their image. <WH6754>
Thus <WH3588> my heart <WH3824> was grieved, <WH2556> and I was pricked <WH8150> in my reins. <WH3629>
So foolish <WH1198> was I, and ignorant: <WH3808> <WH3045> I was as a beast <WH929> before <WH5973> you.
Nevertheless I am continually <WH8548> with you: you have held <WH270> me by my right <WH3225> hand. <WH3027>
You shall guide <WH5148> me with your counsel, <WH6098> and afterward <WH310> receive <WH3947> me to glory. <WH3519>
Whom <WH4310> have I in heaven <WH8064> but you? and there is none <WH3808> on earth <WH776> that I desire <WH2654> beside <WH5973> you.
My flesh <WH7607> and my heart <WH3824> fails: <WH3615> but God <WH430> is the strength <WH6697> of my heart, <WH3824> and my portion <WH2506> for ever. <WH5769>
For, see, <WH2005> they that are far <WH7369> from you shall perish: <WH6> you have destroyed <WH6789> all <WH3605> them that go <WH935> a whoring <WH2181> from you.

But it is good <WH2896> for me to draw near <WH7132> to God: <WH430> I have put <WH7896> my trust <WH4268> in the Lord <WH136> GOD, <WH3069> that I may declare <WH5608> all <WH3605> your works. <WH4399>
